summaryText: What an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about feeling overlooked and unseen! Pastor Travis dives deep into the biblical narrative of David, showing us that even when people dismiss us, God sees our true potential. He powerfully reminds us that God specializes in using the least likely people to accomplish extraordinary things. Sometimes we feel forgotten, passed over, or undervalued, but PT wants us to know that God's perspective is completely different from the world's. He sees your heart, your potential, and your purpose - even when no one else does! Drawing from stories like David and Gideon, Pastor Travis emphasizes that God looks beyond external appearances and sees the inner potential waiting to be unleashed. The most powerful moment? When he declares that what the enemy meant for evil, God will use for good. If you've ever felt like you're not enough, this sermon is a reminder that you are God's first pick, not the world's last choice. God is strategically positioning you, protecting you, and preparing you for something greater than you can imagine!
mainPoints: God sees me, even when others overlook me
Keep my heart right during seasons of feeling unseen
Keep doing what I'm doing for God, not for human approval

versesMentioned.text: You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good to accomplish what is now being done, the saving of many lives.
And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.
The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.

O Lord, you have searched me and known me. You know when I sit down and when I rise up; you discern my thoughts from far away. You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways. Even before a word is on my tongue, O Lord, you know it completely.

The Lord will make you the head, not the tail. If you pay attention to the commands of the Lord your God that I give you this day and carefully follow them, you will always be at the top, never at the bottom.
The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.
Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters.
Am I now trying to win the approval of human beings, or of God? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a servant of Christ.

Monday.scripture: 1 Samuel 16:7: 'The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.'
Monday.focus: Remembering God's perspective is different from human perspective
Monday.action: Write down three things about yourself that you feel are undervalued, and pray over each one, asking God to reveal His perspective.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see myself through Your eyes. Reveal the potential and purpose You've placed inside me that I might not yet recognize. Give me clarity and confidence in Your vision for my life. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 139:14: 'I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.'
Tuesday.focus: Recognizing personal worth and God-given uniqueness
Tuesday.action: Make a list of 5 unique qualities or skills you possess. Reflect on how these could be used to honor God.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, thank You for creating me with intention and purpose. Help me embrace the unique way You've designed me and use my gifts to glorify You. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 4:23: 'Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one negative thought pattern or emotional trigger. Journal about how it impacts your perspective and pray for healing.
Wednesday.prayer: God, guard my heart against bitterness, comparison, and discouragement. Fill me with Your peace and help me maintain a pure heart focused on You. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Colossians 3:23-24: 'Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters.'
Thursday.focus: Cultivating excellence for God's glory, not human recognition
Thursday.action: Choose one area of your work or daily responsibilities. Approach it with excellence and intentionality, doing it as if directly serving God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me shift my perspective from seeking human approval to serving You wholeheartedly in every task. Give me motivation that comes from pleasing You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Friday.focus: Trusting God's transformative power in challenging seasons
Friday.action: Reflect on a past challenge. Journal how God might have used that experience for growth or preparation.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me trust Your process. Even when I can't see the full picture, I believe You are working all things together for my good and Your glory. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 Samuel 16:13: 'So Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers, and from that day on the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully upon David.'
Saturday.focus: Embracing God's unique calling and timing
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal any areas where you might be rushing ahead of His timing or feeling impatient.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, help me be patient and faithful in the waiting. Teach me to trust Your timing and preparation. Reveal Your plans and help me align my heart with Your purpose. Amen.
